Unarmed Strike.Description: Just a punch or slap of the hand.
Special: Unarmed strikes are always considered light attacks and can be used with the weapon finesse feat.
Unarmed strikes do not count as natural weapons

Gauntlet.Description: A metal glove that lets you deal lethal damage with unarmed strikes. Medium and heavy armors (except breastplate) come with gauntlets.
Special: Your opponent cannot use a disarm action to disarm you of gauntlets.

Battle Aspergillum.Description: Named for the common aspergillum, a mace-like tool used by priests to sprinkle holy water, this light mace has a hollow head and a metal plug to fit the hollow’s neck.
Special: When the mace hits a creature, holy water sprinkles out; creatures subject to damage from holy water take 1 point of additional damage.
You must refill the aspergillum after 5 hits with a standard action that provokes an AoO.

Brass Knife.Description: Though brass doesn’t hold as sharp an edge as steel, it isn’t vulnerable to rust like steel is.
Special: Fragile

Brass Knuckles.Description: These close combat weapons are designed to fit comfortably around the knuckles, narrowing the contact area and therefore magnifying the amount of force delivered by a punch.
Special: You may hold an object in a hand wearing brass knucles, but you cannot weild a weapon.
You may cast a spell with somantic components with a concentration check (DC 10 + spell level).
Monk

Cestus.Description: The cestus is a glove of leather or thick cloth that covers the wielder from mid-finger to mid-forearm, ofen reinforced with metal plates over the fingers.
Special: You may wield or carry items while wearing a cestus, howeveer you take a -2 to all precision-based tasks involving that hand (such as opening locks).
Monk

Dagger.Description: A dagger has a blade that is about 1 foot in length.
Special: You get a +2 bonus on Sleight of Hand skill checks made to conceal a dagger on your body.

Punching Dagger.Description: A punching dagger’s blade is attached to a horizontal handle that projects out from the fist when held.

Spiked Gauntlet.Description: A glove made of metal with jagged spikes for extra damage, and the cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet.
Special: An attack with a spiked guantlet is considered an armed attack.
Attached

Traveling Kettle.Description: These small tea kettles are made with clamping lids and heavily reinforced handles.
Special: A traveling kettle with boiling water inside deals an additional 1 point of fire damage on a hit.
Boiling water cools to a non-damaging temperature after 5 minutes.
Monk

Hook Hand.Description: Pirates who lose a hand in the course of their adventures sometimes attach hooks to their wrists.
Special: It takes 1 minute to attach or detach a hook hnad.
Attached
Disarm

Kunai.Description: Crafted from a single piece of iron, a kunai has a leaf-shaped blade and a ring for a pommel.
Special: A kunai can readily substitute for a crowbar or piton without being damaged in the process.

Light Mace.Description: A light mace is made up of an ornate metal head attached to a simple wooden or metal shaft.

Sickle.Description: A curved blade extends from the basic wooden handle, though usable in a pinch the sickle is mainly a farming tool.
Special: Trip

Spring Blade.Description: This 4-inch blade is attached via a hinge to a wooden handle with a slot in the center, into which the blade can be folded.
Special: You gain a +4 bonus on Sleight of Hand checks to conceal a spring blade on your body, and noticing the hidden blade requiers a DC 20 Perception check.
Releasing the blade is a free action, and resetting it is a move action.

Wodden Stake.Description: This close combat weapon is just a sharpened piece of wood. Iron spikes used as weapons deal damage as wooden stakes.

Club.Description: This weapon is usually just a shaped piece of wood, sometimes with a few nails or studs embedded in it.

Mere Club.Description: Traditionally made of carved stone, the mere (MEH-reh) is a short, flat-sided, sharp-pointed club.
Special: Fragile

Heavy Mace.Description: A heavy mace has a larger head and a longer handle than a normal (light) mace.

Morningstar.Description: A morningstar is a spiked metal ball, affixed to the top of a long handle.
Special: A morning star deals both Bludgeoning and Slashing damage at once.

Shortspear.Description: A shortspear is about 3 feet in length, making it a suitable thrown weapon.

Bayonet.Description: Bayonets are close combat weapons designed to fit into the grooves or muzzles of crossbows and firearms.
Special: Bayonets allow you to make melee attacks with these weapons but render them temporarily useless as ranged weapons.
Attaching or removing a bayonet is a move action.

Boarding Pike.Description: A boarding pike is an 8-foot-long pole topped with a foot-long tapered metal tip.
Special: Brace
Reach

Kumade.Description: Adapted from a garden rake, the kumade consists of a wood or bamboo pole topped with a metal claw.
Special: When a kumade is secured to a surface, such as a rafter or window sill, its handle can be climbed as a 5-foot length of rope.
Grapple

Collapsible Kumade.Description: This weapon acts as a kumade, but the handle consists of bamboo sections held together by a taut rope running through the center.
Special: When a kumade is secured to a surface, such as a rafter or window sill, its handle can be climbed as a 5-foot length of rope.
Releasing the rope is a standard action that provokes attacks of opportunity and causes the weapon to collapse into a bundle that fits into a backpack.
Reassembling the collapsible kumade requires a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity.
Grapple

Lantern Staff.Description: This long metal staff has reservoirs for lamp oil, and a lantern-like structure at its head.
Special: The lantern staff is fuelled as and provides light as a hooded lantern.
While lit, attacks with the lantern staff deal 1 point of fire damage in addition to the normal damage.

Longspear.Description: A longspear is about 8 feet in length.
Special: Brace
Reach

Quarterstaff.Description: A quarterstaff is a simple piece of wood, about 5 feet in length.
Special: Double
Monk

Spear.Description: A spear is 5 feet in length and can be thrown.
Special: Brace

Boar Spear.Description: This spear with a spiraling blade has a metal crossbar approximately halfway down its length.
Special: Brace
If you ready a boar spear against a charge and your attack hits, you get a +2 shield bonus to your AC against that creature until your next turn.

Weighted Spear.Description: This pole has a spear head at one end and a mace head at the other.
Special: A weighted spear can be used as a regular spear, or as a double weapon, with the mace head dealing bludgeoning damage and only x2 on a crit.
Brace
Double

Blowgun.Description: Blowguns are generally used to deliver debilitating (but rarely fatal) poisons from a distance. They are nearly silent when fired.

Heavy Crossbow.Description: You draw a Heavy Crossbow back by turning a small winch.
Special: Loading a heavy crossbow is a full-round action that provokes attacks of opportunity, using two hands.
You may shoot a havy crossbow with one hand at a -4 on attack rolls
You can choost a heavy crossbow with each hand, teating them as one-handed weapons (the -4 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).

Heavy Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.
Special: When fired underwater, the crossbow has a range increment of 20 feet.

Light Crossbow.Description: You draw a Light Crossbow back by pulling a lever.
Special: Loading a light crossbow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity, using two hands.
You may shoot a light crossbow with one hand at a -2 on attack rolls
You can choost a light crossbow with each hand, teating them as light weapons (the -2 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).

Light Crossbow (Underwater).Description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.
Special: When fired underwater, the crossbow has a range increment of 20 feet.

Sling.Description: A sling is little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of strings.
Special: Your Strength modifier applies to damage rolls when you use a sling, just as it does for thrown weapons.
Loading a sling is a move action that requires two hands and provokes attacks of opportunity.
You can fire, but not load, a sling with one hand.
You may fire ordinary stones with a sling at a -1 to attack rolls and dealing damage as 1 size smaller.

Stingchuck.Description: A stingchuck is a foul bag made of a humanoid’s head with the brain removed and the skull heavily scored so that it bursts open when thrown.
Special: A sucessful hit releases the contens, dealing 1d6 damage and forcing a DC 11 Fortitude save to avoid being nauseated for 1d3 rounds.
Each round a creature remains nauseated by a stingchuck, it takes 1 additional point of damage from the biting vermin.
All creatures within the splash effect take 1 point of damage from the vermin but do not risk being nauseated.

Stonebow.Description: A stonebow, or bullet crossbow, resembles a light crossbow except for the distinct U-shaped bend in the stock to fire sling bullets.
Special: Loading a stonebow is a move action that provokes attacks of opportunity, requiring two hands.
You may shoot a stonebow with one hand at a -2 on attack rolls.
You can choost a stonebow with each hand, teating them as light weapons (the -2 is cumulative with the two-weapon fighting penalty).
You may fire ordinary stones with a sling at a -1 to attack rolls and dealing damage as 1 size smaller.

Throwing Darts.Description: Darts are missile weapons, designed to fly such that a sharp, often weighted point will strike first.

Crossbow Bolts.Description: These bolts come in a case or quiver that holds 10 bolts (or 5 for a repeating crossbow).
Special: The given weapon stats are for a single bolt, and using it as a melee weapon.
When using the bolt as a melee weapon, treat it as a light improvised weapon, with a -4 to attack rolls.

Crossbow Bolts, Acid.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with acid.
Special: The given weapon stats are for a single bolt, and using it as a melee weapon.
These bolts deal an additional 1d4 acid damage on a sucessful hit.

Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison.Description: These bolts have a strange tip that delivers the poison, but also affects accuracy.
Special: The given weapon stats are for a single bolt, and using it as a melee weapon.
Drow poison (DC 13 Fort)
Range penalties are doubled when using a drow poison bolt

Crossbow Bolts, Fire.Description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with a alchemical fire.
Special: The given weapon stats are for a single bolt, and using it as a melee weapon.
These bolts deal their additional fire damage on a sucessful hit.

Javelin.Description: A javelin is a thin throwing spear.
Special: If used as a melee weapon, you are treated as non-proficient with it and take a –4 penalty on attack rolls.

Sling Bullets.Description: These bullets come in a leather pouch that holds 10 bullets.

Sling Bullets, Groaning.Description: These sling bullets are honeycombed with overlapping perforations that cause them to emit an eerie moan audible within 500 feet of their flight path.

Sling Bullets, Smoke.Description: Smoke bullets burst open when striking a target to release a gas that can nauseate nearby creatures.
Special: Smoke bullets require only a successful touch attack to release the smoke.
The target is nauseated for 2 rounds unless it passes a DC 13 Fortitude save.

Blowgun Darts.Description: These light darts have tiny grooves behind the tips.
Special: A character can apply poison to a blowgun dart without risk of poisoning himself.
